content: This job has been running for a very long time: https://github.com/rust-lang-ci/rust/runs/1333124216
it still seems to be making progress, though
The log also seems to be broken; I can only see a few lines
it doesn't show you the full log until the job ends
Oh nvm then. CI logs often seem like they could be designed better...
yeah, this happens often. the apple runners sometimes just randomly run at about 1/4 their usual speed.
it's not going to finish before the timeout
This happens now more often than not. :/ Several CI runs have timed out now one after the other

Are they failing at the same place (i.e. a real hang) or just going really slow? My experience of the GHA Apple builders on other projects is that they seem over-subscribed and subject to substantial perf variation.
just super slow. seems like sometimes they run at 100% speed, and sometimes at like 20-30% speed. and nothing inbetween.
I think the working theory is sometimes we get much less of a machine
Restarted the last rollup because it was going to timeout anyway, but in the new run x86_64-apple is slow, again. :(
Fourth time's a charm. Looks like a all four are running fast this time.
